entry.et: Middle English estern, from Old English ēasterne; akin to Old High German ōstrōni eastern, Old English ēast east

def.dt: :of, relating to, or characteristic of a region conventionally designated East
:of, relating to, or being the Christian churches originating in the church of the Eastern Roman Empire
:coming from the east an eastern wind
:a bluebird (Sialia sialis) chiefly of eastern North America that has a reddish-brown throat and breast
:the half of the earth east of the Atlantic Ocean including Europe, Asia, Australia, and Africa

:of or consisting of the Eastern churches that form a loose federation according primacy of honor to the patriarch of Constantinople and adhering to the decisions of the first seven ecumenical councils and to the Byzantine rite
:the time of the fifth time zone west of Greenwich that includes the eastern United States see time zone illustration
province SE Republic of South Africa area 65,483 square miles (169,600 square kilometers), pop 6,504,000
desert E Egypt between the Nile & the Red Sea
chain of mountains SE India extending SW & S from near delta of the Mahanadi in Orissa to W Tamil Nadu; highest point Mt. Dodabetta (in Nilgiri Hills) 8640 feet (2633 m) see western ghats
region S Bulgaria including Rhodope Mountains & the Maritsa valley
